  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath6 be a compact symplectic manifold with a hamiltonian torus action by @xmath1 .",
    "then @xmath0 has a moment map @xmath7 from @xmath0 to the dual of the lie algebra of @xmath1 which has the property that for every @xmath8 , @xmath9 , where @xmath10 is the vector field on @xmath0 generated by @xmath11 . the torus action preserves level sets of @xmath2 . if @xmath5 is a regular value of the moment map , then @xmath1 acts locally freely on @xmath3 and the _ symplectic reduced space _",
    "@xmath12 has at worst orbifold singularities .",
    "in particular , the equivariant cohomology of the level set is ( rationally ) isomorphic to the ordinary cohomology of the quotient @xmath13 .",
    "the _ kirwan map _",
    "@xmath14 is the restriction to the level set in equivariant cohomology followed by this isomorphism .",
    "kirwan @xcite showed that @xmath15 is a surjection for all regular values @xmath5 .",
    "let @xmath16 be the kernel of this map .",
    "the main aim of this article is to observe that this ideal distinguishes connected components of the set of regular values of @xmath2 , when the fixed point set consists of isolated points .    in general",
    ", this ideal may be hard to compute .",
    "s. tolman and j. weitsman described a set of generators of @xmath4 in terms of their restriction properties to the fixed point set of the @xmath1 action on @xmath0 @xcite .",
    "the first author ( of this article ) subsequently described these classes in terms of the moment map polytope @xmath17@xcite . preceding these techniques ,",
    "the third author described the ideal indirectly by using cohomology pairings and the residue formula @xcite , a technique we exploit further here .",
    "let @xmath18 be the image of the moment map . for @xmath0 compact",
    ", @xmath19 is a convex polytope which we call the _ moment polytope _",
    "@xcite , @xcite .",
    "the connected components of the set of regular values of @xmath2 form _ chambers _ of the polytope .",
    "these chambers are bounded by the ( non - regular ) values @xmath20 , where the union is over all one - dimensional subtori @xmath21 and @xmath22 denotes the fixed point set of @xmath23 . for any particular @xmath21",
    ", we call the connected components of @xmath24 _ walls _ of @xmath19 , and note that a wall will be codimension-1 in @xmath25 if @xmath23 is one - dimensional and the quotient @xmath26 acts effectively on @xmath22 .",
    "while there have been numerous attempts to describe the geometry as a regular value @xmath5 crosses a codimension-1 wall ( most notably @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) , there has so far been little evidence that global observations about @xmath19 can be made using the techniques of equivariant cohomology . in @xcite",
    "the authors are able to use explicit calculations to find the number of chambers in the image of certain degenerate @xmath27 coadjoint orbits , and e. rassart @xcite has since extended these methods to count the number for any coadjoint orbit of @xmath27 .",
    "the result we present below suggest that an algebraic approach may have merit in answering these questions .",
    "[ th : main ] let @xmath0 be a compact connected symplectic manifold with a hamiltonian @xmath1 action .",
    "suppose the action has isolated fixed points , and denote the moment map by @xmath2 .",
    "let @xmath5 and @xmath28 be two regular values of @xmath2",
    ". then @xmath5 and @xmath28 in are in distinct chambers of the moment polytope if and only if @xmath29 .",
    "one of the difficulties in proving such a theorem is that , for @xmath5 and @xmath28 in distinct chambers , it is not sufficient to find different generating sets for the two ideals .",
    "these two sets could generate the same ideal .",
    "for this reason , our task is to find specific classes which are in one ideal but not in the other .",
    "the quotient of @xmath30 by each of these ideals may result in isomorphic rings .",
    "for example , the reduced space of any generic @xmath31 coadjoint orbit is a 2-sphere for any regular value .",
    "thus the reduced spaces have isomorphic cohomology even though the points of reduction may not be in the same chamber .    before continuing",
    ", we would like to thank etienne rassart and victor guillemin for several insightful conversations with each of the authors .",
    "we also thank the referee for useful remarks on the original manuscript .",
    "the kernel of the kirwan map can be described in two equivalent ways : in terms of cohomology classes and in terms of cohomology pairings .",
    "the tolman - weitsman theorem ( @xcite , theorem 3 ) describes a generating set of the classes in the kernel of the kirwan map , while the jeffrey - kirwan theorem describes how to evaluate pairings ( or integrals ) on the reduced space . because the reduced space is finite - dimensional , and in particular the poincar pairing is non - degenerate , the kernel @xmath4 of the kirwan map @xmath15 consists of those classes @xmath32 for which @xmath33 for all @xmath34 .",
    "our interest is to show that certain classes have non - zero integral and are therefore _ not _ in the kernel of the kirwan map .",
    "our main tool for describing any class is its restriction to the fixed point set @xmath35 .",
    "[ th : injectivity ] let @xmath0 be a compact symplectic manifold with hamiltonian @xmath1 action and fixed point set @xmath35 .",
    "let @xmath36 indicate the connected components of the fixed point set .",
    "the restriction to the fixed point set @xmath37 is an injection .",
    "in particular , a class is determined by its behavior on the fixed point set .",
    "for this reason , we refer to the set of connected components of the fixed point set where the class is nonzero as the _ support _ of a class .",
    "we denote the restriction of @xmath34 to @xmath38 by @xmath39 or @xmath40 .",
    "[ def : support ] for @xmath41 , the _ support _ of @xmath34 is @xmath42 the set of fixed point components @xmath43 on which @xmath34 restricts to a non - zero class .",
    "the residue formula expresses cohomology pairings on reduced spaces in terms of a multi - dimensional residue of certain rational holomorphic functions on @xmath44 @xcite .",
    "the functions are obtained by restriction of equivariant classes to fixed points , and dividing by equivariant euler classes .",
    "while the theorem applies to compact @xmath0 reduced by any compact group @xmath45 , we need ( and present ) only the abelian case below .",
    "the computation of terms in the residue formula depends on a cone @xmath46 in @xmath44 , even though the result of the formula is independent of this choice .",
    "let @xmath47 be the set of all weights that occur by the @xmath1 action at any of the fixed point components .",

    "the goal of this section is to use the restriction properties of @xmath41 to find level sets on which @xmath34 restricts to 0 under the corresponding kirwan map .",
    "in fact we show something stronger , namely that in the case of isolated fixed points there is a basis of @xmath147 ( as an @xmath148-module ) given by certain classes @xmath149 indexed by the fixed point set ( although the choice of these classes may not be unique ) .",
    "the classes @xmath150 are in @xmath4 for a very specific ( and generally rather large ) set of regular values @xmath5 , as we describe below .",
    "first consider the case that @xmath5 is not in the convex hull of the image under @xmath2 of @xmath151 .",

    "in particular , if @xmath5 is not in this convex hull , then there is some @xmath8 whose corresponding moment map component @xmath153 is such that @xmath154 for every @xmath155 .",

    "we note that @xmath156 is a morse - bott function .",

    "atiyah and bott observed that the map @xmath167 is an _ injection _ and hence the sequence splits @xmath168 it follows by induction on @xmath49 that if @xmath34 is 0 on @xmath169 ,  , @xmath162 , then @xmath34 is 0 on @xmath170 and therefore @xmath34 restricts to 0 on @xmath171 if @xmath172 .",
    "when @xmath0 is not khler , we may not have the familiar convexity properties .",
    "the convex hull of @xmath173 may contain regular values that are not in the image of the gradient flow - outs of @xmath151 : see the non - khler example in section  [ se : nonkahler ] .",
    "for these regular values , it is not immediately clear that the class @xmath34 restricts to zero at these regular values .",
    "we use some additional morse theory to prove that @xmath34 does indeed restrict to 0 on these level sets .",
    "we first define the _ extended stable set _ of a critical set @xmath174 .",
    "let @xmath123 be a morse - bott function on @xmath0 , and order the critical sets @xmath157 so that @xmath158 if and only if @xmath175 . let @xmath176 be the gradient flow of @xmath123 with respect to a compatible riemannian metric .",
    "the _ extended stable set _ of @xmath174 is the set of points @xmath177 in @xmath0 such that there is a sequence of critical sets @xmath178 in which @xmath177 converges to @xmath179 under the flow of @xmath180 , and there exist points in the negative normal bundle of @xmath181 that converge to @xmath182 under the flow of @xmath180 .",
    "the extended stable set is also called the extended flow - up ( where  up \" means that the value of @xmath123 increases under the flow of @xmath183 rather than @xmath180 ) .",
    "note that the extended stable set is _ not _ the same as the closure of the stable flow - outs of the critical set @xmath174 .",
    "a manifold with a morse - bott function for which these two are not the same is the hirzebruch surface @xmath184 ( see figure 1 ) .",

    "in the case that @xmath0 is a coadjoint orbit of any complex reductive group , a specific basis for @xmath4 has been described in terms of the choice of symplectic structure on the coadjoint orbit and the reduction point @xmath5 ( @xcite , @xcite ) .",
    "the generators are _ permuted schubert classes _ defined by their duality properties with certain subvarieties of @xmath0 .",
    "they can also be uniquely described by their restriction properties due to kirwan injectivity .",
    "we present the latter description here .",
    "theorem  [ th : schubertrestriction ] can be taken as a definition for readers unfamiliar with schubert classes .",
    "let @xmath194 be a compact semi - simple lie group with borel subgroup @xmath344 and maximal torus @xmath1 .",
    "let @xmath0 be a coadjoint orbit of @xmath194 through @xmath345 .",
    "we identify the weyl group @xmath346 with the fixed point set by associating @xmath76 to the trivial coset , and the remaining points can be identified by the transitive action of @xmath230 on the fixed points .",
    "we write @xmath347 to indicate the fixed point corresponding to @xmath348 .",
    "let @xmath123 be a moment map for a generic @xmath349 action on @xmath0 , such that @xmath350 is minimized at @xmath76 .      1 .",
    "@xmath353 , the equivariant euler class of the negative normal bundle ( with respect to @xmath123 ) of the fixed point associated to @xmath348 .",
    "2 .   @xmath354 unless @xmath355 in the bruhat order of @xmath230 .",
    "schubert classes form a basis for @xmath30 as a module over @xmath335 .",
    "if we use the same construction while allowing @xmath123 to be minimized at other fixed points , we obtain the _ permuted schubert classes _ @xmath356 whose restriction properties can be described in a similar fashion .",
    "permuted schubert classes are precisely the classes predicted by theorem [ th : thomexistence ] . in the case of coadjoint orbits",
    "the _ extended _ flow - up is precisely the closure of the flow - up from any fixed point .",
    "they form ( permuted ) schubert varieties .",
    "there is a very simple description of ideals @xmath4 for coadjoint orbits of complex reductive groups @xcite , @xcite . for any regular value @xmath5 ,",
    "the ideal @xmath4 is generated by the permuted schubert classes @xmath357 such that @xmath5 is not in the convex hull of @xmath358 .",
    "since the number of chambers in @xmath19 is determined by the number of distinct ideals @xmath4 , this simple description offers the possibility of an algebraic method for ascertaining the number of chambers in the moment polytope for coadjoint orbits @xmath359 , for example . of course , these numbers depend on the non - zero value @xmath360 in the positive weyl chamber , whose coadjoint orbit we are considering . for @xmath31 , the number of chambers is six or seven , and does not offer much of a challenge .",
    "e. rassart has computed this number for @xmath27 orbits @xcite using geometric arguments , and has found numbers in the hundreds ( depending on the value of @xmath76 ) , but the @xmath361 case is already out of reach .",
    "it would be interesting to find a bound on the number of chambers for general @xmath362 .",
    "there are several places in the literature in which the behavior of the reduced space , or integrals over these spaces , is studied as the regular value moves over exactly one codimension-1 wall of the moment map .",
    "most notable , perhaps , is the formula due to guillemin - kalkman @xcite , and independently s. martin @xcite .",
    "we present here a short exposition on this result , and then show that theorem [ th : main ] allows us to gain some information about the reduction at singular values of the moment map in the case that the fixed points are isolated .",
    "let @xmath363 be a hyperplane of critical values of @xmath2 such that the line segment between two regular values @xmath5 and @xmath28 intersects @xmath363 but intersects no other hyperplanes of critical values of @xmath2 .",
    "let @xmath364 be a component of the fixed point set of a circle @xmath365 such that @xmath366 .",
    "then guillemin - kalkman give @xmath367 \\right ) .\\ ] ] here , @xmath368 , where @xmath369 is the component of @xmath2 corresponding to @xmath370 .",
    "this requires the choice of a basis element in the lie algebra of @xmath370 , and the same basis element must be used to define the residue .",
    "note that @xmath371 is the reduced space of @xmath364 with respect to the action of @xmath252 , and @xmath372 is the equivariant euler class of the normal bundle of @xmath364 in @xmath0 ; @xmath373 is the kirwan map for the action of @xmath252 on @xmath364 .",
    "the operation @xmath374 is defined as follows . introduce a basis element @xmath63 for @xmath375 and basis elements @xmath376 for @xmath377 , where @xmath23 is a codimension-@xmath378 subtorus transverse to @xmath370 , so @xmath379 .",

    "write @xmath389 and expand @xmath390 using @xmath391 by expanding into a product of power series in @xmath63 we can rewrite @xmath392 as a sum @xmath393 where each @xmath394 is a polynomial in @xmath376 with coefficients in @xmath395 .",
    "in particular , @xmath396 .",
    "we define @xmath397 it is shown in @xcite that @xmath398 is well defined independent of the choice of the variables @xmath63 and @xmath399 .",
    "[ rem4.2 ] this is the residue at @xmath400 of the meromorphic function of @xmath63 defined by @xmath401 .",
    "thus it equals minus the sum of the residues at finite values of @xmath63 ( using the fact that the sum of the residues of a meromorphic 1-form over the riemann sphere is zero ) . here",
    "the meromorphic 1-form depends on one complex variable @xmath402 in the riemann sphere , but takes values in @xmath403    the technique for crossing one wall can of course be inductively applied to more than one wall , obtaining a formula for the difference in the integral over reduced spaces at _ any _ two regular values .",
    "however the resulting formula does not imply that the chambers are distinguished by the ideals @xmath4 , and indeed it may be a lengthy computation using this method to obtain that this difference is non - zero for some class .",
    "we finish this section with a small result on the behavior of the classes that distinguish ideals .",
    "let @xmath5 and @xmath28 be regular values with a line between them crossing exactly one singular value @xmath404 of @xmath2 . by theorem [ th : main",
    "] , there is a class @xmath34 such that @xmath405 but @xmath342 . we may choose a class with the additional property that @xmath406 . by the wall - crossing formula , @xmath407 \\right ) \\neq 0.\\ ]",
    "] choose a @xmath1-invariant riemannian metric on @xmath0 .",
    "then equation ( [ eq : wall ] ) implies that the image of @xmath34 under the restriction    @xmath408^{i^ * } & { h^*_t(n ) } \\ar[r]^{p^ * } & h^*_t(s(\\nu n ) ) \\ar ` r[d ] ` [ l]`[llld]`[d]_{\\cong}[dll ] &   \\\\   &    h^*_{t / s}(s(\\nu n)/s ) \\ar[r]^{\\hspace{.3in}\\pi _ * } & h^{*-k}_{t / s}(n ) \\ar[r]^{\\kappa_{t / s } } & h^{*-k}(n_{red } )   } \\ ] ] is nonzero . the above composition is the  localization map \" defined by @xcite , definition 5.1 . here",
    "@xmath409 is the unit sphere bundle ( with respect to the invariant metric ) of the normal bundle to @xmath364 , and @xmath410 is the reduced space at the singular value @xmath404 .",
    "the maps @xmath411 and @xmath412 are induced by the inclusion @xmath413 and the projection @xmath414 , respectively .",
    "the isomorphism on the curved arrow follows from the fact that @xmath370 acts locally freely on the sphere bundle ( and the cohomology is in rational coefficients ) .",
    "lastly , @xmath415 is  integration over the fibers \" , and reduces degree by @xmath416 , the dimension of the fibers of the ( weighted ) projective bundle @xmath417 , according to the induced orientation defined in @xcite . in particular , not only are the fundamental classes described by theorem  [ th : thomexistence ] nonzero when restricted to level sets near @xmath174 and in the flow - up from @xmath174 , but these classes are nonzero when restricted to the _ singular walls _ on the boundary ( near @xmath174 ) of the cone out of @xmath174 .",
    "it is shown in section 4 of @xcite how to use the formula ( [ eq : wall ] ) inductively to give a formula for @xmath418 in terms of the restrictions of @xmath34 to the components of the fixed point set of @xmath1 .",
    "this formula is obtained by drawing a line @xmath92 from @xmath5 to the boundary of @xmath17 which avoids all codimension-2 walls .",
    "next , for each intersection @xmath419 of @xmath92 with a codimension-1 wall @xmath420 , one draws a line @xmath421 within @xmath420 from @xmath419 to the boundary of @xmath422 .",
    "this process gives rise to a graph ( the term `` dendrite '' is used in @xcite ) originating at @xmath5 and terminating in points @xmath423 where @xmath43 is a fixed point of @xmath1 on @xmath0 .",
    "the quantity @xmath424 may thus be expressed in terms of the data @xmath40 for a distinguished collection of fixed points @xmath43 .",
    "one can easily deduce from the description of the residue given in ( [ e : resdef ] ) that guillemin and kalkman s iterated residue is equivalent to jeffrey and kirwan s .",
    ", while for guillemin - kalkman one chooses a `` dendrite '' .",
    "] see also kalkman s proof of their equivalence @xcite .",
    "we now explore the main theorem in the context of a non - khler manifold @xmath0 , introduced by sue tolman @xcite . in this non - khler",
    "setting , the extended stable sets are not manifolds , or even complex varieties .",
    "we find morse - thom classes on an unusual extended flow , whose image under @xmath2 is not convex .",
    "we first sketch tolman s construction of @xmath0 .",
    "it is obtained from two manifolds , each diffeomorphic to @xmath425 .",
    "this manifold @xmath364 is a toric variety with an effective hamiltonian @xmath426 action .",
    "we restrict our attention to two different @xmath427 actions on @xmath364 , whose moment polytopes are given in figure  [ fig : cut ]  ( a ) and ( b ) .",
    "we then take a symplectic cut of each of these manifolds , along the dotted line shown in the figure .",
    "notice that the symplectic slices , whose moment images are the intersection of the dotted line with the moment polytopes , are equivariantly symplectomorphic .",
    "we use the technique of symplectic gluing to glue the bottom half of figure  [ fig : cut ]  ( a ) and the top half of figure  [ fig : cut ]  ( b ) to construct @xmath0 , whose moment polytope is shown in figure  [ fig : cut ]  ( c ) .",
    "there is a hamiltonian @xmath427 action on @xmath0 , with isolated fixed points .",
    "the moment polytope is given in figure  [ fig : cut ]  ( c ) , and the vertices of this graph correspond to the fixed points .",
    "the restriction of a cohomology class @xmath41 to a fixed point @xmath263 is an element of @xmath428 $ ] ( see theorem  [ th : injectivity ] ) .",
    "thus , we may describe a class in the equivariant cohomology of @xmath0 by giving a polynomial in two variables at each vertex of the moment polytope .    in figure",
    "[ fig : classes ] , we label two points @xmath5 and @xmath28 which are regular values of the moment map for @xmath1 acting on @xmath0 .",
    "they are in different chambers of the moment polytope , and hence by the main theorem , the kernel of the kirwan map is different for each of these values .",
    "we may apply the techniques from the proof of the main theorem to construct equivariant cohomology classes distinguishing these chambers . in figure",
    "[ fig : classes ]  ( a ) , we demonstrate a class @xmath34 in @xmath429 but not in @xmath4 , and in ( b ) , we show a class @xmath32 in @xmath4 , not in @xmath429 .",
    "these classes distinguish these two ideals .",
    "the shaded region represents the image under the moment map of the flow - out of the support of each class , for a given choice of @xmath123 . the fact that the region in ( a ) is non - convex reflects the fact that the manifold @xmath0 is non - khlerizable .",
    "we may contrast this to the setting given in section  [ se : schubert ] , where the classes constructed that distinguish among ideals are supported on permuted schubert varieties . while these varieties may not be manifolds , they are complex , and hence have convex moment image .",
    "one important point about these extended flows is the following .",
    "suppose @xmath5 and @xmath28 are in distinct chambers , and a wall @xmath230 adjacent to the chamber @xmath224 separates them , such that @xmath430 and @xmath312 , where @xmath23 is the hyperplane containing @xmath230 .",
    "let the class @xmath34 be a morse - thom class ( associated to a point on the wall @xmath230 ) constructed by lemma  [ le : relevanteulerclass ] , so that @xmath405 but not in @xmath4 . when the extended stable set is convex , then corollary  [ cor : halfspacesupport ] implies that @xmath431 for any @xmath432 ( the negative half space ) .",
    "however , without this convexity requirement , @xmath34 is not necessarily in @xmath433 for all @xmath434 .",
    "let @xmath435 and @xmath436 be as indicated in figure  [ fig : nonconvex ] .",
    "let @xmath230 be the wall slightly to the left of @xmath28 , as indicated .",
    "the class @xmath34 supported on the shaded region will be in @xmath429 and not in @xmath4 , by the argument given in figure  [ fig : classes ] .",
    "however , it is clear that @xmath432 and yet @xmath34 is not in @xmath433 since indeed @xmath34 is also an equivariant euler class associated with a wall close to @xmath436 .",
    "this example demonstrates the need for the extended flows introduced in section  [ se : equivariantmorsetheory ] ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a compact manifold with a hamiltonian @xmath1 action and moment map @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> the restriction map in rational equivariant cohomology from @xmath0 to a level set @xmath3 is a surjection , and we denote the kernel by @xmath4 . </S>",
    "<S> when @xmath1 has isolated fixed points , we show that @xmath4 distinguishes the chambers of the moment polytope for @xmath0 . in particular , </S>",
    "<S> counting the number of distinct ideals @xmath4 as @xmath5 varies over different chambers is equivalent to counting the number of chambers . </S>"
  ]
}
